item.description: <p>A newly unsealed US Justice Department indictment accuses captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro of running a “corrupt, illegitimate government” fueled by an extensive drug-trafficking operation.</p>

item.title: After Maduro, who's next? Trump's comments spur anxieties about his plans for Greenland and Cuba
item.description: <p>D﻿onald Trump has indicated the US is not done with its military adventurism in the Western Hemisphere.</p>

item.title: Venezuela's billions in distressed debt: Who is in line to collect?
item.description: <p>The toppling of President Nicolas Maduro has thrust Venezuela&#x27;s debt crisis – one of the world&#x27;s largest unresolved sovereign defaults – into the limelight.</p>

item.title: Secretary of State Marco Rubio denies US will 'run' Venezuela despite President Donald Trump's comments
item.description: <p>T﻿he Secretary of State said captured leader Nicolas Maduro&#x27;s deputies would be allowed to govern.</p>

item.title: Maduro's capture sparks celebrations among Venezuelans
item.description: <p>For some Venezuelan natives, the military action brought their dreams of reuniting with loved ones closer to reality after years of heartbreaking separations.</p>

item.title: Alleged Bondi gunman transferred to Supermax
item.description: <p>The 24-year-old has been charged with ﻿59 offences including 15 counts of murder and committing a terrorist act.</p>

item.title: 'Devastated': Tributes for teenagers killed in Swiss bar fire, some of whom were as young as 14
item.description: <p>One is believed to have died trying to save his girlfriend.</p>

item.title: Thieves smash through teen's bedroom window, threaten mum and son with gun
item.description: <p>A group of thieves is on the run after escaping with a safe following the terrifying home invasion.</p>

item.title: Police hunt trio of suspects after multiple bricks hurled into traffic in Melbourne
item.description: <p>Five cars travelling about 80km/h were damaged when large bricks hit their windscreens, with two vehicles needing to be towed from the scene.</p>

item.title: 'I cannot continue': Victorian Deputy Opposition Leader Sam Groth announces retirement, cites party infighting
item.description: <p>T﻿he former tennis pro said internal quarrels within the Liberal Party played a role in his choice to step away.</p>

item.title: Man charged after police vehicle allegedly rammed
item.description: <p>A man has been charged after injured police officers had to scramble for safety as their van was allegedly rammed in a Melbourne driveway last month.</p>

item.title: Comedy trio Sooshi Mango call for harsher laws after CCTV captures man breaking into office
item.description: <p>Australian comedy trio Sooshi Mango has revealed their Melbourne office was broken into overnight, posting CCTV footage of the intruder in a bid to find him.</p>

item.title: First designs for Brisbane's new Olympic stadium revealed
item.description: <p>The first concept designs for Brisbane&#x27;s new 63,000 seat stadium at Victoria Park have been revealed by ﻿Australian architecture firms COX and Hassell.</p>

item.title: More than 16,000 livestock lost as flood levels keep rising in northern Queensland
item.description: <p>A driver and his passenger ﻿have come close to tragedy as their vehicle was swept away by floodwaters in Queensland.</p>

item.title: Pilot escapes injury after light plane crash in Adelaide
item.description: <p>The pilot and sole occupant walked away from the crash uninjured.</p>

item.title: World leaders react with condemnation and caution after US captures Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro
item.description: <p>World leaders have responded with a mixture of condemnation and caution after US President Donald Trump captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and wife Cilia Flores.</p>

item.title: 'No country is safe': Venezuelan president's son emerges, demands parents be set free
item.description: <p>Nicolás Maduro&#x27;s son has railed against the Trump administration and warned that the capture of his father in an American operation could set a dangerous precedent globally.</p>

item.title: Paris court finds 10 guilty of cyberbullying France's first lady Brigitte Macron
item.description: <p>A Paris court has found 10 people guilty of cyberbullying France&#x27;s first lady Brigitte Macron by spreading false online claims about her gender and sexuality, including allegations she was born a man.</p>

item.title: Pam Hemphill was labelled 'MAGA granny' for storming the Capitol. Five years on, she's a very different person
item.description: <p>Hemphill pleaded guilty to a misdemeanour count of parading, demonstrating or picketing at the Capitol Building and was sentenced to 60 days in prison.</p>

item.title: 'I'm a decent man': Maduro's next court date set as wife appears injured
item.description: <p>The deposed Venezuelan leader and his wife have made their first appearances in court after dramatic capture.</p>

item.title: Today in History - January 6: The last Emperor of the Romans is crowned in a small town
item.description: <p>C﻿onstantine XI was crowned in 1449, and his long-lasting empire finally died for good just four years later.</p>

item.title: 'Era of lawlessness': UN blasts Trump over Venezuelan raids
item.description: <p>T﻿he UN Secretary General also said he was &quot;deeply concerned&quot; about the damage done to international law.</p>

item.title: Lego goes hi-tech in new Star Wars sets - no app or screen required
item.description: <p>A﻿ key innovation will bring Lego&#x27;s latest kits to life in a brand new way, the company claims.</p>

item.title: 'OUR hemisphere': Trump's new message to world
item.description: <p>T﻿he White House is doubling down on its claims of domination over all the countries in its region.</p>

item.title: Major sinkhole opens up on popular Melbourne footy field
item.description: <p>T﻿he sudden cave-in is being investigated, while locals are urged to steer clear for fear it may grow.</p>

item.description: <p>The state has been battered by rain to begin 2026, with some areas receiving more than a metre of rain in a week.</p>
